intro: Atropis argentinensis, commonly known as the Argentine nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically purple or violet in color. Its leaves are ovate and have a slightly hairy texture. Atropis argentinensis is often found in dry, open habitats and can thrive in regions with moderate to low rainfall.
